author: David Lumb
description: At CES 2026, Mangoslab's Nemonic Dot prints out labels to stick on everyday items in your life.
title: This Braille Label Printer Helps Blind Friends and Family Grab the Right Pill Bottle

author: Ty Pendlebury
description: Hisense will release the UR8 and UR9 RGB MiniLED TVs in 2026 which promise better colors.
title: Hisense Shrinks $30,000 Tech into Smaller TVs for 2026

description: You'll find a mix of creepy classics and new offerings on the streaming service.

description: Here are some hints and the answers for the NYT Connections puzzle for Jan. 6 #940.

description: Here are hints and the answer for today's Wordle for Jan. 6, No. 1,662.

author: David Watsky
description: Beatbot unveiled the world's first self-emptying robot pool cleaner at CES 2026 today. This pool owner can't wait to take one home.
title: Pool Owners Rejoice: There's Finally a Robot Cleaner That Empties and Cleans Itself

author: Ajay Kumar
description: Object avoidance is a tough nut to crack on robot vacuums, but Narwal's new Flow 2 claims it has the best yet with a mix of on-board processing an AI cloud computing.
title: Narwal’s New Robot Vacuum at CES Promises Massively Improved Object Avoidance, But I Have My Doubts

author: Anna Gragert
description: Allergen Alert, a new device unveiled at CES this week, uses laboratory science to detect food allergens and gluten while you're on the go, preventing potentially life-threatening reactions.
title: A Small Device Unveiled at CES Tells You Instantly If There's Gluten in Your Food (No, Really)

author: Giselle Castro-Sloboda
description: All it takes is a selfie to learn your health data and how well you’re aging.
title: This Longevity Mirror Predicts Your Future Health in 30 Seconds Flat

author: Tyler Lacoma
description: Govee arrives at CES with enhanced ceiling lights that can mimic a real skylight or give you a window to another world.
title: Govee's Dazzling Smart Light Turns Boring Ceilings Into Skies, Maps and More

author: Kourtnee Jackson
description: CEO Jensen Huang will give a presentation today during the tech event.
title: How to Watch Nvidia's CES 2026 Keynote Live

author: Macy Meyer
description: At CES 2026, a new feeder from Swiss startup AI Tails uses a camera to analyze feline expressions and help diagnose your ailing kitty.
title: This AI-Powered Smart Feeding and Drinking Station Told Me I Was a Sick Cat

author: Scott Stein
description: The bricks can recognize other bricks, activate effects, play music and a lot more. They're debuting in Star Wars Lego sets this spring but you can get an early look at CES 2026.
title: Lego's Making Sensor-Studded Smart Bricks, Coming Soon to a Star Wars Set Near You

author: David Watsky
description: Consider yourself out of excuses for not installing a leak detector. Droplet's new model clips onto pipes in seconds to protect your home from leaks, bursts and water overuse.
title: A Clip-On Water Monitor and Leak Detector I Saw at CES Requires Exactly No Installation

author: Tyler Graham
description: The AMD keynote will be presented by CEO Lisa Su. We expect to hear about a lot of AI developments -- and maybe some new silicon, too.
title: How to Watch AMD's Keynote Presentation Livestream at CES 2026

author: Aaron Pruner
description: Ethan Hawke's terrifying villain is back.
title: Blumhouse's 2025 Horror Hit Is Bringing the Scares to Streaming

author: Omar Gallaga
description: First a leaker posts information, then Motorola releases a video showing a book-style foldable phone.
title: Motorola Teases a First Look at Razr Fold Ahead of CES Reveal

author: Jon Reed
description: Thine doesn't have its own pin or necklace to listen to everything so you can remember your conversations. It's just an app.
title: An Always-On AI Notetaker? This Startup Thinks You Can Just Use Your Phone

author: Lori Grunin
description: The Snapdragon X2 Plus offers much of what's in the higher-end X2 Elite, but the Plus versions are destined for more affordable, everyday AI-focused Windows laptops.
title: Qualcomm Brings Its Cheaper Snapdragon X2 PC Chips to CES

author: Matt Elliott
description: The flagship OmniBook Ultra looks super slim, and even the entry-level OmniBook 3 gets an OLED option.
title: HP OmniBooks Get New Looks, OLED Displays at CES 2026

author: Ty Pendlebury
description: The TCL X11L boasts 'Super' Quantum Dots and will be available this month in sizes starting at 75-inches
title: TCL's X11L TV Promises to Be More Big, More Bright, More Colorful

author: Giselle Castro-Sloboda
description: you can take these workout classes in the comfort of your living room.
title: Best Workout Mirrors for 2025

author: Ty Pendlebury
description: The Ember Artline TV has magnetic frames and an ambient sensor that knows when you're in the room.
title: Amazon Reinvents 4K Range With the Ember Artline TV

author: Macy Meyer
description: Traditional pet doors can allow in pests, weather, other animals and even intruders. The Power Pet Roll-Up Door aims to fix that.
title: This Automatic Smart Pet Door Only Lets In Your Dog or Cat

author: Katelyn Chedraoui
description: Google is bringing even more of its Gemini AI to TV devices, including nano banana.
title: AI Slop Is Coming to Some Google TV Devices, Whether You Want It or Not

author: Mike Sorrentino
description: TCL's expanding its NxtPaper line into more creative pursuits, including stylus support and new photography modes.
title: TCL's NxtPaper 70 Pro Pairs With a Stylus to Be a Notebook and a Phone

author: Katie Collins
description: A new wave of humanoids are coming. Qualcomm is ready to power them.
title: Qualcomm Bets Big on Robotics, Beginning With This Bendy-Backed Humanoid

author: Scott Stein
description: I beamed some super-bright displays in my eyes at CES 2026. Also, TCL's experimenting with eSIMs in its other standalone AR glasses.
title: TCL's New Display Glasses Are the First I've Seen With HDR, and the View Is Vivid

author: Ajay Kumar
description: Bosch's new cordless vacuums at CES 2026 are designed to compete with the best Dyson and Shark models. I got to try them early.
title: CNET First Look: Bosch’s New Feature-Packed Cordless Vacuums Are Designed to Take On Dyson and Shark

author: Tyler Lacoma
description: I've never seen a smart display quite so large and in charge as this CES model.
title: Cozyla Calendar Plus Max: This TV-Size Home Display Wants to Run Your Life for You

author: Tyler Lacoma
description: The OwlGuard at CES is cute, modular and even works offline when something goes wrong -- I'm kind of smitten.
title: Lockly's OwlGuard Security Camera Has Tricks to Defeat Wi-Fi Jammers and More

author: Abrar Al-Heeti
description: I checked out the new foldable at CES, and it feels like a wildly practical two-in-one device, thanks to its massive display and overall sleek build.
title: Samsung Galaxy Z TriFold Hands-On: This May Be the Phone-Tablet Hybrid We've Been Waiting For

author: Katelyn Chedraoui
description: The Vocci AI smart ring feels like an Oura ring designed to act as a personal assistant at work.
title: This AI Smart Ring Can Listen In on Your Meetings

author: David Watsky
description: Euhomy's new Leopard X1 ice maker, unveiled at CES 2026, looks like it just broke the land-speed record.
title: The Coolest Thing at CES? You Won't Believe How Fast This Ice Maker Makes Ice

author: Katie Collins
description: Forget foldables, this might just be the most unconventional phone design I've seen in years.
title: Honor's Audacious Robot Phone Is Real and I Just Got a First Glimpse

author: James Bricknell
description: Coro is a highly accurate breastfeeding monitor for new mothers that's debuting at CES 2026.
title: This New Breastfeeding Monitor Would Have Helped My Preemie Baby

author: Ajay Kumar
description: Two new smart locks from Lockin don't require batteries at all. They're a game changer for renters or apartment dwellers who can't run wires.
title: My Favorite CES Product Might be This Ingenious Wireless Smart Lock

author: Ty Pendlebury
description: The 130-inch TV features native MicroRGB LEDs instead of a traditional LCD display, and it'll be expensive.
title: Samsung Massive MicroRGB is a TV For the Billionaire in Your Life

author: Ty Pendlebury
description: The W6 is a wireless TV designed to sit flush on the wall and is claimed to be reflection-free.
title: LG Rolls Out Its W6 Wallpaper OLED TV With Ultra-High Brightness

author: Geoffrey Morrison
description: The latest version of Samsung's little projector now has AI, because of course it does.
title: Samsung Updates Its Freestyle Plus Projector With 'Additional' AI

author: Katie Collins
description: This virtual pet grows physically bigger the more you play with it.
title: Finally, I've Found a Worthy Successor to the Iconic '90s Tamagotchi

author: Antuan Goodwin
description: Donut Labs and partner Verge Motorcycles claim they’ve got the world's first all-solid-state battery in a production vehicle, with many more to come.
title: This Phone-Sized Solid State Battery Is Already Powering a Production EV

author: Vanessa Hand Orellana
description: This $600 Body Scan 2 measures things most people only hear about in a doctor's office and can calculate how fast your body is aging.
